newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline steady, but supplies tightening.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline steady, but supplies tightening.

text.p: NWE gasoline was steady on Friday morning, but traders said growing demand in Eastern Europe and continuing demand from the United States kept supply tight.
And imminent refinery maintenance in many large northern refineries meant some usual suppliers were not able to offer any product.
Premium unleaded barges were talked at $207-208 fob ARA, and regular was $7.00 lower.
One trader expected slowing West African demand and bigger super-low octane Russian exports to widen this spread.
